meanings.definition: To give or assign value to something.
meanings.sent1: I always try to valorise my family's traditions.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to valorise her old jewelry by getting it appraised.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to valorise his hat by pulling out a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's kind words valorised the student's efforts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature really valorised the painting.

meanings.definition: To enhance the value of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding a fresh coat of paint can valorise an old house.
meanings.sent2: Investing in renovations can valorise a property.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to valorise the dish by adding a sprinkle of gold dust.
meanings.sent4: Her smile valorised the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp collection was valorised by expert collectors.

meanings.definition: To promote or praise the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The company's marketing team worked hard to valorise their new product.
meanings.sent2: She always valorises her friend's achievements.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously valorised the importance of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The coach valorised the team's dedication to training.
meanings.sent5: The author's book launch event valorised her literary contributions.
